name: munificently

in a way that is very generous: It is hard to entertain important guests munificently in such a small room. The project should be not just adequately funded, but munificently funded.
More examplesFewer examplesThe king munificently allowed the bishop to keep control of all the churches. We were not munificently rewarded for our work, but it was enough.His mother munificently offered to pay for his trip.The company claims that it provides munificently for its workers.He waved his hand munificently in the direction of the tables loaded with food.
